entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 2:26AM MST until January 18 at 5:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches for Converse, Niobrara, Dawes and Northern Sioux Counties. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches for Platte and Goshen Counties.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County; North Snowy Range Foothills

entry.summary: ...Light to Moderate snow expected today and tonight... entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 17 at 12:51AM MST until January 17 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Areas of dense fog producing visibility one quarter mile or less. * WHERE...Portions of central, south central, and southeast Montana. Portions of north central Wyoming.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 12:48AM MST until January 18 at 9:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Higher amounts of around 3 to 5 inches are possible along the foothills of Casper Mountain on the south side of Casper. * WHERE...Natrona County Lower Elevations.
